title.narrative: CHILD RIGHT MONITORING SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Office of Good Governance under Prime Minister, Child Protection and Justice for Children Council, KAS, and relevant CSOs have strengthened capacity in evidence-generation systems, child rights monitoring and reporting, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, institutions in Kosovo at central and municipal levels are accountable and responsive to monitoring children's rights, promoting social inclusion, and advancing a social protection system (grants and services) that is also responsive to the needs of the most marginalized children (including vulnerable returnee children belonging to all ethnic communities)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Office of Good Governance under Prime Minister, Child Protection and Justice for Children Council, KAS, and relevant CSOs havestrengthened capacity in evidence-generation systems, child rights monitoring and reporting

description.narrative: The Office of the Prime Minister endorsed the Child Protection Indicator Framework. The 2020 MICS was launched jointly with the Kosovo institutions and was attended by over 400 participants. To further strengthen monitoring systems, UNICEF in collaboration with the Ministry of Education and Science initiated the mapping of pre-university education according to the International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED, 2011 and ISCED-F, 2013). In collaboration with the National Institute of Public Health and Ministry of Health, a working group was established to facilitate the revision of immunization records and digitalization of data collection on immunization and home visiting. ; | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2021
